agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Health TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, May 1, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Senfronia Thompson The chair may limit testimony time and the number of testifying witnesses to ensure consideration of posted and pending business, especially if testimony would cause the public hearing to extend into the next calendar day. HB 517 Israel | et al. Relating to unprofessional conduct by mental health providers who attempt to change the sexual orientation of a child; providing penalties. HB 1578 Thierry Relating to establishing the Mental Health Crisis and Suicide Prevention Task Force. HB 3152 Raymond Relating to the membership of the State Board of Dental Examiners. HB 3999 Turner, Chris Relating to reimbursement for health care services provided to certain first responders; creating a civil penalty. HB 4285 Zedler Relating to the authority of pharmacists to furnish certain medications. HB 4515 Raney Relating to the provision of sex offender treatment by certain physicians and psychologists. HB 4610 Shaheen Relating to the emergency detention of certain persons with a mental illness or cognitive disability. HB 4145 Zwiener Relating to the prescription of a controlled substance to certain patients for the treatment of pain. SB 10 Nelson | et al. Relating to the creation of the Texas Mental Health Care Consortium. SB 436 Nelson | et al. Relating to statewide initiatives to improve maternal and newborn health for women with opioid use disorder. SB 633 Kolkhorst | et al. Relating to an initiative to increase the capacity of local mental health authorities to provide access to mental health services in certain counties. SB 748 Kolkhorst | et al. Relating to newborn screening and the newborn screening preservation account. SB 749 Kolkhorst Relating to level of care designations for hospitals that provide neonatal and maternal care. SB 1636 Zaffirini Relating to an annual report prepared by the Health Professions Council. SB 1827 Menéndez Relating to the possession and emergency administration of an epinephrine auto-injector by law enforcement agencies and peace officers. SB 2151 Kolkhorst Relating to the Texas Diabetes Council and the state plan for diabetes and obesity treatment and education. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: HB 4145 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
